title: Tiffany and Lucy Watson celebrate Halloween in style
text:
Tiffany and Lucy Watson were getting into the Halloween spirit early over the weekend.

The stylish sisters were seen celebrating at Secret Brunch in London on Saturday thanks to the Let's Day Out app, looking super chic in sophisticated black ensembles.

The former Made In Chelsea stars dressed to impress in black dresses and matching blazers.

Spooky stuff: Tiffany and Lucy Watson were getting into the Halloween spirit early over the weekend, partying at Secret Brunch in London on Saturday thanks to the Let's Day Out app

Tiffany opted for a flowing, lace number with a daring thigh-high split, accessorising with strappy heels.

Meanwhile, Lucy donned a simple LBD and added a pair of sparkling dangling earrings to complete the look.

The girls posed up a storm with feather embellished masks, taking an elegant approach to Halloween costumes.

Let's Day Out is an app that brings together small groups of unique people at event experiences across London.

Glamorous: Tiffany opted for a flowing, lace number with a daring thigh-high split, accessorising with strappy heels

Strike a pose: The former Made In Chelsea stars dressed to impress in black dresses and matching menswear inspired blazers

It is available to download on all iOS devises and will soon be available soon on Android.

The sisters' outing comes after Lucy revealed she wants to spread her message about veganism and animal activism on television.

She has already used her position as a reality TV star on Made In Chelsea to launch a career as a vegan ambassador and animal activist; and has made waves with a line of creature-inspired jewelry, plant-based cookery books, a range of freezer food and a vegan restaurant in West London.

But Lucy has no qualms about admitting she wants to get back onto TV, and use it as a platform to continue her mission to 'help make some changes in the world'.

Quality time: The siblings were making the most of spending the weekend together

I would really love to do a docu-series on food, animal rights, animal welfare - and on a channel I haven't worked with.

'So not the ones I used to work with,' Lucy told MailOnline. 'That's what's exciting for me. I like to work in front of the camera and with a crew.

'And I want what I do to be educational, inspiring. To help make some changes to what's going on in the world.'
description: Tiffany and Lucy Watson were getting into the Halloween spirit early over the weekend.
